Variation.description: A representation of the state of one or more biomolecules.

Expression.description: Representation of a variation by a specified nomenclature or syntax for a Variation object.  Common examples of expressions for the description of molecular variation include the HGVS  and ISCN nomenclatures.

MolecularVariation.description: A variation on a contiguous molecule.

SystemicVariation.description: A Variation of multiple molecules in the context of a system, e.g. a genome, sample, or homologous chromosomes.

Allele.description: The state of a molecule at a Location.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.

state.description: An expression of the sequence state

Haplotype.description: An ordered set of co-occurring variants on the same molecule.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.

members.description: A list of Alleles that comprise a Haplotype.  Members must share the same reference sequence as adjacent members. Alleles should not have overlapping or adjacent coordinates with neighboring Alleles. Neighboring alleles should be ordered  by ascending coordinates, unless represented on a DNA inversion (following an Adjacency with  end-defined adjoinedSequences), in which case they should be ordered in descending coordinates.  Sequence references MUST be consistent for all members between and including the end of one  Adjacency and the beginning of another.

CopyNumberCount.description: The absolute count of discrete copies of a Location or Gene, within a system (e.g. genome, cell, etc.).

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.

location.description: A location for which the number of systemic copies is described.

copies.description: The integral number of copies of the subject in a system

CopyNumberChange.description: An assessment of the copy number of a Location or a Gene within a system (e.g. genome, cell, etc.) relative to a baseline ploidy.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.

location.description: A location for which the number of systemic copies is described.

copyChange.description: MUST be one of "efo:0030069" (complete genomic loss), "efo:0020073" (high-level loss), "efo:0030068" (low-level loss), "efo:0030067" (loss), "efo:0030064" (regional base ploidy), "efo:0030070" (gain), "efo:0030071" (low-level gain), "efo:0030072" (high-level gain).

SequenceLocation.description: A Location defined by an interval on a referenced Sequence.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.

start.description: The start coordinate or range of the SequenceLocation. The minimum value of this coordinate or range is 0. MUST represent a coordinate or range less than or equal to the value of `end`.

end.description: The end coordinate or range of the SequenceLocation. The minimum value of this coordinate or range is 0. MUST represent a coordinate or range greater than or equal to the value of `start`.

SequenceReference.description: A sequence of nucleic or amino acid character codes.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

refgetAccession.description: A `GA4GH RefGet <http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/refget.html>` identifier for the referenced sequence,  using the sha512t24u digest.

residueAlphabet.description: The interpretation of the character codes referred to by the refget accession, where "aa" specifies an amino acid character set, and "na" specifies a nucleic acid character set.

ReferenceLengthExpression.description: An expression of a length of a sequence from a repeating reference.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

length.description: The number of residues in the expressed sequence.

sequence.description: the Sequence encoded by the Reference Length Expression.

repeatSubunitLength.description: The number of residues in the repeat subunit.

LengthExpression.description: A sequence expressed only by its length.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

LiteralSequenceExpression.description: An explicit expression of a Sequence.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

Range.description: An inclusive range of values bounded by one or more integers.

Residue.description: A character representing a specific residue (i.e., molecular species) or groupings of these ("ambiguity codes"), using [one-letter IUPAC abbreviations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Union_of_Pure_and_Applied_Chemistry#Amino_acid_and_nucleotide_base_codes) for nucleic acids and amino acids.

SequenceString.description: A character string of Residues that represents a biological sequence using the conventional sequence order (5’-to-3’ for nucleic acid sequences, and amino-to-carboxyl for amino acid sequences). IUPAC ambiguity codes are permitted in Sequence Strings.

Adjacency.description: The `Adjacency` class can represent either the termination of a sequence or the adjoining of the end of a sequence with the beginning of an adjacent sequence, potentially with an intervening linker sequence.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.

adjoinedSequences.description: The terminal sequence or pair of adjoined sequences that defines in the adjacency.

linker.description: The sequence found between adjoined sequences.

Coding.description: a concept codified by a terminology system.

label.description: A primary label for the coding.

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the terminology system.

Mapping.description: A mapping to a concept in a terminology system.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

relation.description: A mapping relation between concepts as defined by the Simple Knowledge Organization System (SKOS).

Extension.description: The Extension class provides VODs with a means to extend descriptions with other attributes unique to a content provider. These extensions are not expected to be natively understood under VRSATILE, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes when needed.

Code.description: Indicates that the value is taken from a set of controlled strings defined elsewhere. Technically, a code is restricted to a string which has at least one character and no leading or  trailing whitespace, and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents.

IRI.description: An IRI Reference (either an IRI or a relative-reference), according to `RFC3986 section 4.1  <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-4.1>` and `RFC3987 section 2.1 <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987#section-2.1>`. MAY be a JSON Pointer as an IRI fragment, as  described by `RFC6901 section 6 <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6901#section-6>`.

Condition.description: A disease or other medical disorder.

TraitSet.description: A set of phenotype and/or disease concepts that together constitute a condition.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

aliases.description: Aliases are alternate labels for a Domain Entity.

Disease.description: A particular abnormal condition that negatively affects the structure or function  of all or part of an organism and is not immediately due to any external injury.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

aliases.description: Aliases are alternate labels for a Domain Entity.

Phenotype.description: An observable characteristic or trait of an organism.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

aliases.description: Aliases are alternate labels for a Domain Entity.

TherapeuticProcedure.description: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect  that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

TherapeuticAction.description: A therapeutic action taken that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

aliases.description: Aliases are alternate labels for a Domain Entity.

TherapeuticAgent.description: An administered therapeutic agent that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

CombinationTherapy.description: A therapeutic procedure that involves multiple different therapeutic procedures  performed in combination.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.

components.description: The individual therapeutic procedure components that constitute the combination therapy.

TherapeuticSubstituteGroup.description: A group of therapeutic procedures that may be treated as substitutes for one another.

substitutes.description: The individual therapeutic procedures that may be treated as substitutes.

Gene.description: A basic physical and functional unit of heredity.
